problem:
Find the value of the following expression:

$$\left| \, |{ -|{-1 + 1}| - 1 }| + 1\right|.$$
chatgpt_solution:
We have $-1+1 = 0$, so ${-|{-1 + 1}| - 1} = {-|0| - 1} = -(0) - 1 = -1$.  Thus, \begin{align*}
\left| \,|{-|{-1 + 1}| - 1}| + 1 \right| &= \left| \,|-1| + 1 \right|\\
&= \left| \,1 + 1 \right| \\
&= \left| \,2 \right|.
\end{align*}Since $|2| = 2$, the value of the expression is $\boxed{2}.$
